46750723:
Pros: The view was breathtaking. Waking up every morning to that was stunning. Having the choice to swim or sit in the sauna was great. Temperature inside was never an issue with the air conditioner working well. Bed comfortable but we did bring our own pillows (personal choice). Left bottle of wine for us and little mini Cadbury chocolates on either side of the bed. Drove into Avoca each day and had a blast. Catching taxi's to and from dinner was a non-issue. A beautiful area to stay in and we will be coming back to Avoca.

Cons: Whilst yes the pool is private in the sense that it is yours only to use, privacy was definitely an issue. Lovely but loud family next door can see you in the pool, and if you go to lean on the balcony you can see into their pool and they see you too. If you score a lucky break and neither house on each side is occupied then enjoy! Also had to clean all the debris off the top of the pool before each use. Sauna didn't work but Paul was available via phone to talk us through resetting it and even offered to drive out the next day from Sydney if we couldn't fix it (thankfully we got it going). Dirty European pillows (hair) and Dirty dishes/glasses. $80 housekeeping fee if you leave any mess (ironically, such as dirty dishes) and you must remove all rubbish to the bins outside before leaving. Smaller than photos make it look but definitely large enough for two guests. Definitely not what I would expect for such a high price. Would not stay again.

All in all, the apartment is good- nice furnishing, tidy, it's got all the amenities to make it a comfortable stay in the apartment. We certainly had everything  we needed (fridge, stove top, pots, plans, cutlery, utensils, HDMI plug in the tv- bring your own cord) to cook ourselves great meals and relax in the apartment. Nathan was lovely to speak to over the phone: but here's a few tips from our experience to make it a little bit better:

-The balcony gets a view of the carpark- not much to look at, until you go to the pool and spa area, or just come down to ground level and near the water. 

-Do your research on The Entrance, perhaps make a few calls or book activities in advance if you are feeling like you want your stay to be adventurous. There's plenty to do (Website hidden by Airbnb) just not always obvious. The area had a little bit of a ghost town feel to it, mainly due to lots of shops going up for lease, but there would still be a lot of people coming, especially around the time of the pelican feeding.

26100253:
Nathan was a great communicator and we collected the keys and found the apartment easily. 
First impressions of the hotel were that it was grubby and dated - the carpets needed a good vacuum in the reception.
The room was spacious and situated in a good location for the shops/restaurants. It is very family friendly and there is a lovely restaurant called ‘ Cocos’ that services fab Asian cuisine. There is also a great candy shop 2 minutes away. 
The pool area is lovely.
The apartment was nice and clean however the bed sheet was dirty and stained so we had to make up a new bed. Nathan responded immediately and was very apologetic. The fan in the bathroom was very dirty and one of the bedside lamps didn’t work.
I was looking forward to a relaxing weekend as I’m heavily pregnant and although we didn’t go away to simply watch television! We were disappointed as the television reception was bad so we couldn’t even watch a film sadly in the evening.
The bed was advertised as king size bed but it was two single beds pushed together although it was comfortable if you didn’t roll over into the middle !
Nathan did refund our cleaning fee and sent us messages to try to rectify some issues but it was a shame as did impact our last weekend away together as a couple. 
Nathan did let us know that he will fix these issues so hopefully the next visitors have a smoother stay.

21312186:
All I can say is all the previous reviews were completely accurate about Karen's place!  We couldn't fault anything, and my partner loved it so much we will be back in a couple of months :)

Everything is exactly as pictured.  Thoughtfully built and designed to make great use of the space and stylishly furnished.  So not only does it look great, it works brilliantly and you have all the creature comforts and more.  The view is as breathtaking as in the photos if not to say the reality out does the photos.

Everything was spotlessly clean, sheet crisp, floors/bathroom/kitchen immaculately clean and lots of extras that aren't typically provided from tissues, to shampoo and conditioner and lots of food items including bubbles, cheese platter, eggs, milk, butter, jam... the list goes on!  You could certainly turn up and be well provisioned for breakfasts and more and then just enjoy some local meals out - you wouldn't need to bring much with you given how generous Karen is.

Karen was brilliant in all her communication, very happy to provide loads of additional information on local eateries, directions and just general tips and tricks including where to park.  She even told us to pack lightly given all the extra bits and pieces that are at the property - not that we listened to that too well ;-)

She was also too happy to assist with anything extra we needed and even gave us some complimentary liquor to try as we were asking her about a local producer we were thinking to visit.

I'd VERY highly recommend Karen's property as well as her as a host.  This is the first time we will be returning to any where we've booked through Airbnb as we enjoyed our stay and all aspects of both the property as well as the wonderful hosts Karen and Bruce.  This is a rather special spot and hosted by two wonderful people.

You won't be disappointed.
104752938: We had a lovely stay. Karen was very accommodating and made us feel very welcome. Would stay here again. Thanks Karen.
111881571: Nothing to fault, Karen and Bruce were great! Giving us advice on where to go, what to do and see. Fresh cheese platter along with champagne and fruit. We loved every minute of it! Highly recommend waking up early to watch the ocean whilst soaking in that beautiful bathtub. Thanks again!
91400557:
Karen went above and beyond to make sure our stay was as great as it could be, if not better. She absolutely thought everything through when it comes to amenities and she also added a nice touch by leaving you goodies in the fridge. Now, the studio. It honestly felt like we were staying at a beach resort and were on a honeymoon. The location is perfect - close to cafes, restaurants, Bouddi National Park and more. 76042169: My partner and I stayed two nights at Sea Salt and we couldn't have been happier. Karen and her husband were so welcoming and helpful. The studio is beautiful and the view is amazing. This north Avoca apartment is a must stay for the area. We unfortuantly only had one night to stay but Karen & Bruce were amazing hosts. 24139026: Our stay here at North Avoca Sea Salt was just amazing. Karen and Bruce were incredible hosts and went far above and beyond to make our weekend a most enjoyable experience. 11891028:
North Avoca Sea Salt was an absolute delight! The view was magnificent and Karen was an extremely thoughtful host – I would definitely recommend staying here.
Karen was easy to communicate with, greeted us on arrival and helped bring our luggage up the lush garden path. When a wayward frond caught my boyfriend, Karen immediately grabbed the garden shears and cut it back – a small detail that shows the level of care Karen takes with her guests. 
The interior of the flat is gorgeous – stylish soft furnishings, enormous bath tub and kitchen facilities. The fridge was stocked with a delicious array of breakfast goodies, including the most flavoursome strawberries! We loved the chilled champagne :-)
Also, I really appreciated Karen texting me during our stay to let me know the monthly Avoca markets were on.
A great spot to enjoy the sea air!
57957374: My partner and I were only able to stay a single night but we wish it could of been more! 54382195:
This is the most amazing place to stay, I couldn’t rate it highly enough.

5254028: Sea Salt is one of the best and most unique places we have stayed - Karen is a wonderful host who makes you feel very at home and with some thoughtful and generous touches. 139368194: Sea Salt is a truly fabulous holiday destination for couples or singles looking for a peaceful seaside retreat on the Central Coast. 4232643:
Sea Salt was perfect in every way!
 
Just a quick drive up from Sydney, it was easy to find and perfectly located a few minutes walk from the beach and a short drive to local shops where you can stock up on everything you need. 
 
Karen and Bruce were lovely and welcomed us on arrival, giving us some tips on the local area and making sure that we had everything we needed for our stay. 
 
The studio itself was immaculately clean, full of all the mod cons and home comforts that you could possibly need and beautifully kitted out. The bathtub should get a special mention, as it was amazing to enjoy the fantastic view of the sea while relaxing. 
 
The outdoor area of the studio was also special, with a great view of the beach and the beautiful surrounds, it was hard to tear yourself away from. We also enjoyed the wildlife in the area, which made you really feel like you were far from the city. 
 
Another fantastic touch was a fridge stocked with cheese, fruit and even a bottle of bubbly for our arrival. 
 
Sea Salt is the most thoughtfully put together Airbnb that I have stayed at and it made for such lovely weekend. I would highly recommend staying at Sea Salt and will probably be making my way back there soon.

We could not have asked for a more wonderful stay! It is true, the photos don't do this beautiful place justice. THIS is the place to come to switch off, to relax and take in the sights and sounds of peaceful nature, the wildlife, and the ocean waves rolling in. My daughter and I enjoyed the quiet surrounds of dining on our deck, chilling out, and the bath...the glorious bath!...but also loved that the beach is just a short walk down the hill (and a great cafe called Boy and The Rose!)  and Terrigal with it's shops, cafes and beautiful beach, is only a quick 5 minute drive. 
Karen and Bruce are the best hosts we've experienced on Air BnB.

60211202: What can I say.. It was simply fabulous and fantastic!! Karen is indeed a super host who thought through all the details to ensure her guests are comfortable. But Karen and Bruce absolutely made our weekend. They are so friendly and interested. Karen took my mum and I for a nice morning swim and showed us the area. Also she drove us to the station when we needed to leave. 

I will absolutely recommend this apartment to people who would like to have a relaxing weekend/week off in an quiet but lovely area. 108617555: This was my first Airbnb stay and I think it's set a high bar for the other hosts I'll stay with in the future. The Lakehouse is in a great location for exploring the Central Coast, especially if you have a car. Michele is pleasant and respectful of her guests' privacy, and she made check-in and check-out very easy even for someone like me who keeps weird hours. The house felt cosy and safe, and comes with basics like breakfast cereals and fruits and milk which saved me a trip to the grocery store. But my favourite parts of the house by far were the covered patio and the floating platform at the end of the jetty. My favourite moments in this house were spent working on my computer on the patio in the dark, looking up and seeing the moonlight on the water just a few footsteps away from me. A few footsteps more, and I could sit on the end of the jetty and close my eyes as it rose and fell on the waves. I'm glad I stayed here, and I hope to come back again some day.

I am a seasoned traveller and have used Air B& B both in Australia and internationally. This was the first time however that I wanted to travel with my large Labrador pup and that made finding accommodation that would take both of us, very difficult. We have just returned from our stay at Rebecca’s place and we loved it.  The location is awesome, ‘the humans’ beach is just ‘next door’,  and the  ‘dog’ beach  is a healthy walk or short car drive away. The yard is fully enclosed so I had no concerns about my dog getting out and the cabin was clean and had no evidence of having dog tenants before. 

The Cabin was private and the sound of the ocean lulled me to sleep. A tip for those staying here, do yourself a favour and go outside and look at the night sky - living in the city you forget what the night sky should look like. 

Rebecca and her family were very welcoming - we hope to stay here again.

21462196:
You won’t find a better location in Bateau Bay — or a better host! 

We spent three nights at Rebecca’s place and loved every minute. The cabin stayed cool in the heatwave, the bed was super comfortable and we were just two minutes’ walk from the most stunning beach on the Central Coast.

The description is accurate — a dog-friendly rustic beach cabin with outdoor loo. It’s comfortable and was perfect for us (a couple) and our two dogs. The pups loved the fully-enclosed garden and we were comfortable leaving them at times during the day. 

The bathroom is adjacent to the cottage. It’s large, well lit and clean.  The shower has a strong spray — perfect for rinsing off sand and sunscreen, and the toilet is modern with a good flush. 

There is an outside deck with a table, umbrella and chairs. We enjoyed our breakfast here every morning. Plenty of bird life to keep us — we spotted kookaburras, tawny frog mouths, brush turkeys and rosellas. 

Bateau Bay beach is gorgeous and we enjoyed swimming there. Dog-friendly Shelly Beach was a short drive away. The cottage is also a short drive from The Entrance and Terrigal. 

Rebecca gave us loads of local tips for restaurants, including the best fish and chips in the area. 

We had a great stay and would book again in a heartbeat!

Mary and Anthony are such warm hosts who provided A+ experience in their comfy and inviting home. Tastefully furnished and decorated with coastal vignettes in various areas complemented the beautiful waterfront views.
The bed, pillows, sheets and doona were comfy and we slept well. The room also had info leaflets which provided recommendations of local outlets and other interesting reading material for the avid reader. 
There was also a dedicated kettle and coffee plunger which are perfect for the early morning or late night caffeine cravings, and there was also little wafers and mint for when we get peckish. 
We loved the high quality towels provided - so soft and fluffy, much better than other places we stayed previously (including some hotels!). 
A fully equipped bathroom completed the experience, Mary and Anthony truly thought of all the little things that made the entire experience so warm and comforting.
One of the highlights - being welcomed by the friendly "Hospitality Manager" Bella. 
We highly recommend staying with them as they are centrally located to allow for exploring the Central Coast area, and there is street parking too. Shops are also walking distance for those who want to take in the fresh lakeside air and being only 20 mins to the M1 via the Ourimbah exit makes it really convenient for travel.
Two thumbs up!

I've always loved Lake Tuggerah, the cycleway is magnificent, the house, is right near the pedestrian foot bridge. In the other direction, it's an easy walk to the Tumbi Umbi river. The public transport there has always been good, I've overnighted 4 times there , near Shelly Beach, as well as a couple of times in Long Jetty. Trains to Sydney in 1.5 hours, Newcastle in an hour, lots of buses at the nearby mall, with loads of shopping. Going North to Wyong, South to Gosford and of course to the Tuggerah station. With Westfield mall, just further on the same bus routes. Or you can take the coastal bus, North, head South, on the coast from Erina Fair mall. It's a delightful area, beaches, lakes, parks, easy walking, what's not to like ?!!

24140164:
Mary and Anthony were the best hosts we have ever had on Airbnb. Absolutely lovely and welcoming, they made us feel at home during our two night stay in their home. 
The house is perfectly located in front of the beautiful lake, in a very quiet street with many birds flying around and pelicans swimming in the lake just across the road. The house is very comfortable, clean and tidy, with a nice backyard where they grow their own vegetables. 
Mary and Anthony gave us very good tips of where to go and eat and thanks to them we saw the most beautiful sunrise in Shelly Beach earlier today. Anthony also invited us to share a crab that he had just caught in the lake - one of the trip highlights!
My partner and I were lucky enough to have Mary hosting her cooking classes at home when we were there and we were invited to join. For an affordable price we learned how to make pasta from scratch, had salads with fresh picked ingredients and we had a great time with a group of locals who also attended to the cooking lesson. 
It was a great experience to stay with them, and we definitely learnt more about sustainable living. It was a very inspiring weekend!
We recommend everyone travelling to the Central Coast to stay with Mary and Anthony!
11142491:
Mary and Anthony are lovely friendly hosts and interesting people to meet.  This was our first AirBnB experience and we felt very welcomed and instantly at home.  
Their house is modern, eclectic, clean and very comfortable. The bedroom has a relaxing view of the lake, nice linen and gets the afternoon sun (great for our nap).  If, like us, you like watersports, you can walk your SUP or kayak across the street and into the lake.  The veggie garden is something to behold. 
Killarney Vale is handy to the Entrance and the coast and we had some great meals out in local restaurants and cafes and as well as a short trip up to Norah Head for an afternoon outing.  Ask Mary and Anthony and they'll point you in the right direction.  
We loved meeting Bella - a very gentle, sweet dog.  Unfortunately she didn't want to come home with me.  
We absolutely recommend this AirBnB home and hope other future experiences match up to our first.

If you are looking for standard affordable shelter, this listing is precisely as described and a tad better. But if you have illusions about alighting in a home away from home, where you shall not feel like a stranger; counting your steps, pondering your words, or fearing to offend or be offended; well … you’ve hit the jack pot the minute you arrive at Mary&Anthony’s bastion of hospitality and kindness. Mary is a joyous extrovert. She expresses herself like a soprano who keeps high pitching even after the show, whereas Anthony speaks in clear, deep voice, and short precise sentences. The contrast is simply magnificent! 
Now Bella. The she-dog. Not a bitch in any sense in my opinion. On the contrary, I found myself having a philosophical discussion with her about various existential questions. Although we didn’t always agree, we remained friends and walked by the lake, watched the pelicans taking off like jet fighters and conglomerating  aslant the sunset…My advice: Visit Mary&Anthony’s when you can, trust this seasoned traveler. 
Jad

49065209:
Many thanks to my wonderful hosts Mary&Anthony!

After driving 700km, I found a wonderful good-night sleep at a beautiful home by the lake, just as described! Even though I arrived way passed the actual the check-in time (after 8pm), everything was setup perfectly with easy to the point instructions how to make myself comfortable. Mary made sure no questions were left unanswered including local travel trips, and served coffee which I enjoyed at their massive sundeck overlooking the Tuggerah lake. I even was lucky enough to try the best 100 % organic Cantaloupe melon I've ever had in m live which came directly from their back veggie garden. The area is beautiful as well. After I enjoyed my morning on the deck, I went for a run along the lake and checked out the jetties spotting some fish. Make sure you arrive at Mary&Anthony's home just before the sun goes down (which I unfortunately missed), because you will most likely have one of the most stunning sunsets.

Bottomline, this AirBnB deserves all the stars in the hospitality world!

207491356: I stayed with my partner and 2 small children. Comfortable and clean. Easy to book. A lovely yard for the kids and tv with dvds.  No bath but only stayed one night. Warm with air con. Breakfast was an added bonus. Would happily stay again.

111521886: My two kids and I loved our stay at Kaye and David’s place and would highly recommend it. Everything was inviting from the private lawn with a safety gate and relaxing deck to the comfy bed and entertaining decor. We had a great stay! Thank you.

7215215: Fantastic cosy little home, perfect for a weekend away. Highly recommended!

14965769:
Our stay at Kaye and Dave's has been an absolute delight.

8032452: Kaye and David's place was the perfect stop over for our night traveling to QLD. 59103675: We had such a great experience with Kaye and David. We can't wait to come back again so we can do all the things we missed out on during our short, but wonderful stay!
92760587: Outstanding facilities, clean, nice touches to feel right at home!
16317703: Thank you both for an excellent stay
97043370: Kaye and David's place was great - would totally recommend it.  Lovely location, clean and spacious - Kaye and David have gone to great lengths to ensure the comfort of their guests. 7891777: Really great space inside and out. We only stayed for a night but it was a lovely environment and we wished we’d stayed for longer!
169368405:
Kaye & David’s accomodation is a lovely place to stay with.  It is super clean,  well maintained, and very romantic. 191306639: I booked last minute and David and Kaye were there within the hour. Everything was clean, super comfortable and came with extras. Coffee!!!!! 5 stars!
17750292: Kaye and David's place is lovely.  We arrived to chilled wine in the fridge and the next morning enjoyed delicious home made museli. Would highly recommend their place for a weekend getaway and Avoca is a great area to explore.
95344935:
Such a lovely spot.
Private, secluded and close to whatever you want to do around the area!

22347546: Lovely, spacious apartment. Lots of extra touches, very generous. Friendly, helpful hosts, it was a pleasure to stay here and very relaxing.

26708690: Wonderful location, beautiful space, thoughtful inclusions.
50494102: We loved our stay at Kaye and David’s place. The food and wine was a lovely touch.
32935534: Great little apartment. Tranquil location  where the birds wake you up. Peaceful. About 25 minute stroll to the beach which I personally loved. Great value for money. Lovely breakfast and bottle of vino waiting for us.

73780547:

139638130: Kaye and David’s home was very relaxing. The house was very clean and cozy. They provided a lovely continental basket of goodies as well as a bottle of wine which was so thoughtful. My kids loved the grassy area out the front. Thank you for having my family at your place.
3263855: We had a thoroughly enjoyable weekend at Kaye and David's. The accommodation is pleasant, comfortable and private and the thoughtful little extra touches make the experience very special.

347701:
We had a great time at Kaye and David's place!

21470415: Had a wonderful stay at Kaye & David’s place. Great location. Private deck was wonderful to sit on in the afternoons. Quick communication & easy check in. Close to the beach, surf club & beautiful national park. Would definitely stay again.
89974094: Cool space in a quiet part of Avoca. Kaye and David were super helpful with info on the area and suggested places to eat (had an awesome dinner at Bombini). Highly recommended
5029520: The apartment is the perfect set-up and location for a getaway in Avoca Beach, we would definitely come back. 169378679: Kaye & David are wonderful hosts, thinking of little details to make our stay more comfortable. Their home is warm, inviting, clean & comfortable.
123168970: We had a great one-night stay at Kaye and David's place! The apartment had such trendy furnishings and was very clean and well-equipped. 11026183:
It was lovely to stay at Kaye and David's place.....peaceful, quiet, loved the birds, appreciated the wine and birthday card, wonderful photographic work line the walls.  Liked the retro feel and quality bedding.

36493028:
Thoroughly recommend staying at David and Kaye’s. The personal touches are fantastic and they go all out to make you feel comfortable.

62691367: Kaye and David are lovely hosts. Very welcoming and availavle when we needed something but we also felt that we had complete privacy. 6853621:

130682381: We had a beautiful time in this lovely place! The pictures looked good but in reality it was even more comfortable and cozy. We felt lost in the green while being literally just 5 minutes from beautiful beaches and amenities. Highly suggested!

5127515: Kaye was great communicating ahead of arrival with access and local area info, and a lovely host, leaving us some goodies! 116033760: My wife and I had a lovely stay at Kaye and David's place. Very comfortable, quiet, and with real character. Tips about visiting Putty Beach, and the Sunday market at Avoca, were spot on! Can recommend the local Indian restaurant too, for an easy takeaway.
13169975: Lovely clean apartment, great communication, peaceful area with lots of birdlife
76044896: We had a nice time staying at Kaye and David's place. Thank you very much
33780503: Kaye and David's place was perfect! Walking distance from the beach, shops and cafes and also just a short drive to Terrigal. 6933668: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Kaye & David's place. One of the most fully decked out places we've stayed in, with all the little details covered that make a big difference. Big thumbs up and highly recommended!

46520898:

27768733: We had such a lovely stay here. All too brief! The apartment is exactly as described - clean, well appointed and full of personality. The continental breakfast was a very generous extra touch and made our overnight stay with 2 kids that much easier. I hope we'll get a chance to come back!

5437836: Great place, the deck is a real highlight, David and Kaye are lovely, left us some snacks and a bottle of wine which was a nice touch, they're available to assist with anything you need which is great.

11316681: Very relaxing spot, especially liked the rocking chair on the balcony :-)

54588352:
Although due to wedding madness not allowing me to meet my hosts, the apartment was fantastic. Clean, comfortable and great location.

17861079: Great place. Clean, comfy, modern, interesting. Very quiet. Hosts were particularly helpful in allowing us to book the day we wanted to arrive. Lovely garden feel on the deck.
5807457:

1753245: Kaye and David are lovely welcoming people, their place is wonderfully quiet and charming. A very comfortable bed and a great deck to relax on. Everything you need and more. Thanks so much
6612921: Thanks so much for allowing us to stay in your private getaway. Comfortable, clean and cosy, with our every need catered for, we only wish we could stay longer. Highly recommended!
5523923: Charming place, perfect for the weekend
58828201:
David was accommodating and very helpful.  He gave us advise on the local specialties and best sites to see.

Marlene and sister Doris
17320788: The place was very welcoming and beautifully kept. We had a very relaxing time. The hosts have been very attemptive and tried to make us feel as comfortable as possible. Would definitely recommend this charming place to anyone that is after a relaxing holiday
13290273: The house was perfect for our small little family. The outdoor deck and balcony was a hit with the little ones and the place was neat, tidy and exceptionally clean! 7157299: The place was beautiful, quite and spacious! It was very nicely decorated, really felt cosy and homely! We really enjoyed staying at your place. 30829435: David and Kaye were great hosts the accom was great location was great and the breakfast was great wish we could have stayed longer.
58651601:

32006437: Thoroughly enjoyed our weekend in the Bush Surf retreat that is so aptly named! it was homely, comfortable, welcoming and inspired us to explore moving to this beautiful part of the world.  David & Kaye were warm and friendly and left us to enjoy the peace & tranquillity but really responsive when it came to showing us how to use the DVD player!  thanks for your lovely hospitality.
31483792: Beautiful location and beautiful accommodation. The David and Kaye were very hospitable. Local attractions were amazing.
2890132: Kaye and David were very hospitable and easy to communicate with, they even allowed us to bring our dog for the weekend. The house is a split level and they live upstairs. 5090202:
Kaye and David made us feel very welcome - the place is very clean and comfortable and is well appointed with all the creature comforts including a big DVD collection, a lovely breakfast supplied for the first day and a great BBQ. 18317330: We had a fantastic stay at David and Kaye's place. It was in a great location with many beaches nearby, and a lovely deck to relax on in the evenings. David and Kaye provided us with everything we needed including a hamper of goodies for breakfast and snacks. They were attentive hosts and always replied promptly to questions. Definitely would recommend their place to everyone travelling to the area!
43671951: We had a wonderful stay here and only wish we could've stayed longer. Kaye and David were very friendly and helpful hosts, always available if needed. Highly recommended for your next getaway.
10182756:
We had a lovely stay at Dave and Kaye's  Place. such a lovely house. We loved the photos, piano and guitar also the dvd collection was perfect to unwind of an evening.
Can not recommend enough. Thank you for having us.
35668507: A beautiful space, very thoughtfully finished. The deck was wonderful and we could sit out even when it was raining. Most attentive and responsive hosts- a perfect stay!
24570594: An extremely cozy place with all the conveniences. We especially enjoyed sitting on the deck reading and hearing the tranquility of wildlife to the point that we did not once use the TV. I would highly recommend this lodging to anyone passing through the Central Coast.
35435183:

21204973: We loved our time at bush tranquility. There is so much room, only 1 bedroom but accommodated 3 adults, 1 child and a baby very comfortably. 47757322: We had the most amazing time here the apartment was brilliant. It had everything we could possibly need and was so quiet and comfortable. We were celebrating at the time,so we had a truly magical stay. Thank you.
19993251: Kaye and David were absolutely lovely, and the place was beautiful. Everything was very clean, and we really appreciated the breakfast supplies. The house is also very close to Avoca beach, and we loved David's photos on the wall (he's a photographer).  The cat and dog were v. cute too!
29148183: David and Kaye went out of their way to make sure we settled in comfortably. 15920462: Thank you David and Kaye for having us. It was lovely, peaceful and relaxing (exactly what we needed). The place is spacious with a collection of DVD's, boardgames that kept us entertained. 43918037: Beautiful spot with a lovely green outlook. Tranquility is spot on, this would be a great spot to unwind. Kaye and David are great hosts and really helpful.
39879967: David and Kaye made arriving and getting settled a breeze and were quite flexible with the check in and check out times. 18179236: He was there when we arrived, and tour us around the house. And I love that welcome note and goodies...really nice.
31447198: We had a delightful couple of days here. The appartment is beautifully set up with a private access, garden and deck. 10065986: David and Kaye were very welcoming, their home was clean, homely and setup with all the essentials for our stay. 45250535: David was an excellent host, who was very friendly and helpful with the local neighbourhood hot spots. The place was incredibly homey with a spacious verandah and large bedroom. Would definitely recommend!
6724722: What an amazing little slice of heaven!! Kaye and David were AMAZING hosts- even leaving a welcome basket for when we arrived. The place was lovely with your own huge balcony and front yard. We will definitely be returning to Avoca again! Thanks so much Kaye and David :)
32558674: Kaye and David were great! House was very comfortable, loved the brekkie basket! They've thought of everything. Thanks for a great stay!
37455185: Thanks for the friendly welcome and the delicious breakfast hamper .  The apartment was a great place to stay and the surroundings with all the birds and beaches was great.  Definitely would love to come back.

38615195: David was really helpful in being flexible with checkin, the apartment was really well prepared for our arrival and really comfortable!

2270088:

37542268: Kaye and David were great hosts, they were extremely accommodating and made the place seem very welcoming and homely.
3803707: Lovely, warm and welcoming home. Kaye and David prepared a hamper of treats for our arrival, they were very flexible and accommodating and the home was clean and well presented. 29495858: Kaye and David were awesome hosts and very friendly. The place was cosy. It definately matched the description. Would stay there again if I visit North Avoca in the future.
32572531: Nice decoration, very clean and cozy.  The kitchen had everything we needed for BBQ dinner and the a/c kept us warm at night.  David and Kaye's cat joined us while we were having tea on the deck and took a short nap on my lap - very cute!  Good location, kind hosts, highly recommended!
31106364: We had a great stay! the location was excellent for our needs, the home was warm & the hosts were very accommodating!
17910926: We had a very comfortable and relaxing stay, surrounded by greenery and the sound of birds. 2877172: A fantastic stay. Kaye and David were the perfect hosts. The apartment is beautifully furnished and has everything you need. The location is a great base to explore the area and is near enough to some great cafes and restaurants in Avoca Beach. Would recommend and stay again.

4308941:
The place was just as pictured. Lovely and clean. 27680547: A delightful little oasis in Avoca Beach. Well set up and run, Kaye and David provided amazing customer service from the outset. The apartment is very sweet and exactly what we needed for our mini break. I'd recommend to all.

4195571: Our stay at Bush Surf Tranquility was fantastic. The decor is beautiful, and the it's a wonderful space to relax in. Kaye and David were very welcoming and helpful. We thoroughly enjoyed our time in Avoca.

3944051:

I have to say I can't fault David's place at all. It's immaculate, it has true character and there is some really nice personnel touches such as memorabilia from David's illustrious and fascinating career as a celebrity photographer.

I would highly recommend this place!
20420168: Such a beautiful space! We had the most beautiful night and wished we could have stayed longer! We were treated like royalty! Will definitely stay again.

24134640: We really enjoyed our stay . 2909755: Kaye and David were amazing hosts. We were able to stay a total of 6 nights and enjoyed the comfort of the down stairs apartment. 8653289: David and Kaye were very welcoming hosts. What's described on their page regarding the kitchenette facilities is accurate - it's just worth noting that it's fine for a meal for the one night, but would be a bit limited with just the one electric frying pan and no hob if we had been staying longer. All in all though a nice stay. Thanks!
24467034: A fantastic location in the lush valley behind Avoca beach. The house was better than great and the hosts provided for more than we expected. 24302234: The house was peaceful, clean and charming. The continental breakfast basket with home-made muesli was delicious. There was plenty of space to lounge around and relax.

18285698: David was very quick in replying to all my numerous questions. They both were absolutely lovely! They decked out the fridge for our arrival and set out the place to be very homely. 3477648: We came up to Avoca for a weekend break from Melbourne and this was just the perfect little haven to relax. 22867706: We really enjoyed our stay. The apartment was very clean, comfortable and well equipped. The deck area is beautiful and a relaxing place to sit for a drink or dinner. 22667428: Our stay was awesome.  I must say the basket of food for breakfast was more than enough for both days and the home made muesli was a great touch. 8845054: Kaye and David were great hosts. They were very organised and had everything arranged for us when we arrived. It was great we could meet them when we arrived and also when we left. 6378617:

167537981: This was a great space, quirky and Kaye and David were great hosts.

Steve and Carol

421524: Self contained, private  studio near the beach.

Your own private studio with self contained kitchen and bathroom,  near the beach, golf, bike tracks, Wyrrabalong National Park Coast Track.  All amenities and continental breakfast. 76701716:
Judy and Murray are such warm, friendly and accommodating hosts, they made me feel welcome straight away. 
The cabin is lovely, very spacious, comfortable, private and surprisingly warm for July. There is everything you need in the cabin including kitchen facilities; crockery, cutlery, fridge, toaster, pizza oven, pots and gas cooktop. Judy provided generous breakfast supplies including fresh fruit, cereals, bread, spreads and choice of milk. The bed is super comfortable and warm and the shower is amazing! 
The cabin is less than 5 minutes walk to beach, and is also close to shops, golf course and surf club. The neighbourhood is quiet with no noisy neighbours or traffic, so it's a nice break from Sydney.
Judy and Murray went out of their way to ensure I had what I needed including maps information and advice on local walks and sights. Hope to visit again.

About a 5-10 minute drive to the busier area at The Entrance as well if you want to visit the markets and restaurants there.  Judy and Murray had lots of suggestions for places to eat and visit.

1575592: It doesn't get any better!  Judy and Murray have thought of everything to make their little studio comfortable and convenient. We loved staying at Max's house at Daleys Point. It was in a great location right on the water with lovely views and decorated perfectly for a beach house. We arrived in torrential rain, but the house was cosy and light and airy so we could easily hang out while waiting for the sunshine to come out. 

Waking up in the main bedroom to views of the water was spectacular. It's all setup for a group of people with plenty of spaces to chill out, read, listen to music or watch movies. The kitchen was well equipped and we had a BBQ one night out on the deck under the stars. You don't really need to leave the house, but if you do, there's plenty to do in the local area - we went and bought fresh oysters and prawns at the Fisherman's Co-op in Woy-Woy and spent a day at Hardy's Bay and Killcare. 

Max was great to deal with from start to finish - he was always available to answer questions from the very first enquiry and on call during our stay if we needed anything. He was also very understanding when our rental car didn't start so we needed a slightly later check-out while waiting for the NRMA. 

We'll definitely be back.

We used the kayaks & fishing rods most days (kayaking on the glass-like water during morning light was incredible) and followed Max's advice for a great little woodland walk to Hardy's Bay. We enjoyed our stay in this lovely and old country style home. 

This was a lovely retreat which I would definitely recommend with some adjustments. We particularly loved the kitchen dining which was perfect for team cooking, games and chat. There were lots of cushions & blankets for comfort in the cold weather. The upstairs lounge was lovely with a beautiful view.

We had great difficulty with the driveway which was impossibly steep and unlit at night. We were unable to drive our VW Golf over the edge without bottoming out. The two SUV's managed but turning at the bottom was very difficult.

We were pleased to be accepted by the host when enquiring about our combined 5 large dogs. Unfortunately it rained for the duration of our stay. We would have happily cleaned but facilities were limited.

The advertised 1x queen and 2x double beds, actually included 1x daybed (accurately reported in the detailed expl) which converted but was unfortunately broken & unusable. One of us slept on an old unconfortable mattress on the floor. The host was surprised & apologetic. The Queen bed sloped downward at the top which was somewhat uncomfortable. 

Watch out for the neighbours who are understandably protective of their driveway spaces. We left a driver in one car on the road (while 2 of us ran inside to change shoes) who was approached by an upset resident who hassled him about the car. Other neighbours took photos of us and our vehicles & appeared hostile.

15238396: Reflections is a lovely place for a getaway,  with a fantastic location on the water and an easy drive from Sydney. The place had everything we needed and Mark and Anne were very accommodating. We really enjoyed our stay here.
43306005: Great place, beautiful apartment. Loved the private wharf, only wish we stayed longer to make the most of the accomodation.
112469172: Lovely and clean premises good location
98514400: Mark and Anne were wonderful hosts, friendly and very accommodating. The unit is cosy and has everything you need for a private and comfortable stay. The highlight for us was the outside BBQ area backing onto the water which we made use of every evening. Mark & Anne open up this area to guests and we took up their invitation to treat this as "our own space". We spent some lovely time with them on our last 2 nights and really enjoyed their company. I can highly recommend Mark & Anne's place to anyone looking for a comfortable, enjoyable and relaxing stay in Woy Woy.
83000438: 'Reflections' on the water is a great little spot on the central coast. Within close proximity to both Woy Woy and Umina beach, the locality of the place is amazing. Would stay there again any day!
106103864: Awesome location, great view, comfortable and clean room and incredible value. Would recommend to anyone.
26084130: This property has been well described by Mark land Anne.  It may be slightly further from the train station but it is an easy and safe walk of about 20 minutes.  Buses are also available but we did not use them.  There are two good shopping centres with large supermarkets near the station, and other interesting speciality shops.  Woy Woy is a very central location for visiting the local region.
279686:
The place is great and the view is amazing. 
The host went to extra miles to provide all the things that we needed. Even the towels, toothbrush and toothpaste. 
The big TV was awesome and the house had a very romantic ambience with all the candles around. 
The check in and check out were easy with no issues and we enjoyed our BBQ time for dinner. 
This will be the kind weekend gate away that everyone needs! :)
Thank you very much.
23601628: This place was just great for us. The private jetty is where we spent most of our stay, 5 days.  Mark and Anne was very hospitable.  We had dinner together with a huge 70 cm flatty on the BBQ. And we could use their weber BBQ on the deck too. Yes, the train line is near by with trains passing, we got over it very quickly. Light sleepers bring earplugs. We slept through every night. Communication was excellent, and the place is tastefully done up. Will be back going again, great for fishing too.
3406991: Mark and Anne were friendly hosts. The unit was quiet and cosy. The pier on the water and views were nice.
50035987: A most enjoyable mini break and a great place to paddle our kayaks.
84801223:
On arrival the lights were on in the house and beautiful smelling candles lit, which was a lovely touch. 
The unit was very homely with lots of little extras provided if needed (soaps etc). 
We enjoyed our coffee on the back deck in front of the beautiful bay. 
Overall a great experience.
18730978: Reflections is a lovely spot - I was only there for an overnighter but it was what I needed. Within walking distance of the train station, and with a good little Thai restaurant just up the road. The flat is comfortable, private, and self contained, with access to the water front. Communication with Mark was easy and instructions for checking in and so on were easy to follow. Thanks Mark and Anne!
39559155:
Fantastic, cute little place. Nice deck out the back too, with nice water views (would have been great for a bbq - but we didn't have time). The train can be a little noisy but luckily doesn't come around too frequently.

Comfortable stay overall though!
4651018: Even though Mark and Ann weren't around they made the communication very smooth and prompt. Location suited us for a quick trip. Trains a little noisy (mainly their warning horns) for some quiet country folk.
5218743:
Mark and Anne were away while we were there, but gave us perfect instructions for access. The location is brilliant; waterfront and close to the train station, shops and cafe.
We would certainly love to stay at "reflections" again.
89800736: A wonderful spot to stay for the weekend with all the creature comforts that you need. My partner and I loved our stay.
67168237: I was looking for a weekend to unwind and relax and got exactly that! Everything was clean and tidy. Access to the jetty was available whenever needed and they even lit the fire pit on their deck when the sun started to go down. The space is literally below the garage but i didnt notice them go in and out while staying there so it didn't bother me.
44404311: Mark and Anne were very welcoming and provided us with an enjoyable weekend experience on the coast. Their deck was ours to use, complete with a bbq, firepit and water views. Highly recommend for anyone wanting to get away from it all on a budget.
67157497: Anne & Mark are very helpful & organised. The flat is cosy & warm, with clean bathroom & kitchen facilities. The best thing about this accommodation is the outdoor area at the front (waterside) of the house where the front yard meets the water and a small private jetty juts out over the river. All types of water birds, including ducks, cranes, geese, and Australian natives make this area their home-perfect for a relaxing morning, afternoon, or evening. Friendly people, warm & welcoming.
12784422:
A warm and cosy apartment awaited us on our arrival. We were greeted by Mark and Anne who made sure we settled in comfortably.
The apartment had everything (plus more) we needed for our short stay. 
Mark and Anne invited us to use their deck which overlooks Brisbane Water. Very picturesque and relaxing.
The place is situated close to a railway line. While the noise didn't bother us, a light sleeper might find the occasional train rattling through annoying.
34709813: Mark and Anne have a special place and the accommodation was of a very high standard. We enjoyed their company and meeting members of their family.The views out over the water where  stunning. Thanks for a great stay. Brad and Penny.
4186435: The host canceled this reservation 33 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
10062463:
Mark and Anne’s place is beautiful. Its situation by the water is a perfect spot to enjoy a coffee or afternoon wine. Mark and Anne were lovely hosts and were very thoughtful in respecting our privacy.
I’d recommend to anyone wanting a weekend escape.
10129266:
A gorgeous view off the dock, and a truly relaxing space. You will enjoy how peaceful it is there!
Mark and Anne have thought of everything, all the little details have been thought of before you arrive!
76055252: A beautiful place that is exactly as advertised in a great location in woy woy. I stayed for 6 nights and wish i could have stayed longer and enjoyed the area as was only there for work. Would definately stay again
241213532: It was a great place to stay at very cosy and the ideal getaway from the city. The amenities provided just added more comfort and convenience to our stay. Even the train sounds didn't bother us much. We were expecting some breakfast, but there was nothing other than sachets so that was a bit disappointing. The view from the deck is not the same as the images, when we went there was no water visible, but we didn't use that area much so that didn't impact our stay much. Overall, it was a very nice stay and we enjoyed it and we were very comfortable and cosy!
1459713: What a wonderful place for a weekend retreat from the stresses of Sydney. This little piece of paradise sits perfectly upon a beautiful bay. The attention to details within the interior of the home are thoughtful and tasteful as well. It’s amazing how you an only be an hour from Sydney and feel a million miles away. Would stay again in a heartbeat. Awesome.
62843039:
A decent 5 star location. Magnificent 
Apart from a temporary wifi problem, had a great time. Will visit again
46035006: a nice place at stay in summer.. a bit cold in winter.
79132502: Wonderful place to stay a night. Our only complaint is the train, they run what it seems like every 15 minutes. The place is super clean, the hosts are amazing.
74002387: Great self contained unit, clean with great facilities. Shame we were only staying for one night.
6672006:
This is a great little place. Clean, stylish, and lots of little extras that made it seem like we were really being welcomed. The little deck and jetty overlooking the water were a great place to sit and watch the world go by.

Was great that we could use the lockbox to check in and out without the need to contact the hosts. Made it super simple to just show up and leave when we wanted. 

The house is about 15 minutes from the train station and town. The town doesn't have that much to offer, but we weren't missing anything because we could prepare simple food where we were and were happy enough sitting by the water. We also hopped on some local buses to take us to some of the local beaches.

Overall, we had a lovely stay.
18193882: Very comfortable arrangements. Good sized bathroom, cosy bedroom, well stocked kitchenette. Easy check in. Lovely quiet location and convenient parking. Suited our needs exactly.
2674613: Its a great place! Would love to stay again :).
31847792: What a relaxing weekend getaway this place was! Coffee on the jetty, a cosy night in -- just what I needed!
8680032: nice place on the lake, our late arrival was warmed by candle light
23793391: Great location, close to woy woy centre and a beautiful spot of the water. If you're after quiet and scenic this is the place for you!
21313459: Lovely little suite, clean and so well decorated, we loved the place and the front view where we could stay by ourselves and enjoy a relax escape. Mark was really welcoming, thanks again.
61335242:
Anne and Mark were great hosts. They weren't at reflections when we arrived, but they replied quickly to questions we had. We had full access to the deck and BBQ area. As well as the jetty. The accommodation was lovely, very cosy and lots of added extras that really made it wonderful. 
We would definitely stay at reflections again.
3591362: The unit is well-sized, well-equipped and with a gorgeously large and comfortable bed and a super clean bathroom.  Mark and Anne were very welcoming and generous with supplies, even a welcome card and bottle of wine - really kind touch.  There is no view from the unit but walk down beside the house and the jetty is there - I swam twice (only possible at high tide) but beautifully quiet and calm.  An extremely comfortable couple of days with very friendly and helpful hosts.
